hourly.summary: Gunners fans are buzzing with optimism – Big Vik being compared to the Juggernaut, tactical flexibility putting Havertz in a '9 1/2' role, and squad depth so good it's giving selection headaches. The vibe? Title charge energy with a side of 'could Spurs actually get relegated?' banter topping.

daily.summary: Arsenal fan sentiment shifted dramatically from pre-match optimism to mid-game frustration/anxiety during a tense 1-0 phase, before soaring into euphoric confidence after a decisive 3-0 victory extended their league lead. Though minor concerns about injuries and individual inconsistencies persisted, the dominant post-match trend was bullish title belief fueled by Gyökeres' standout performance and rival slip-ups. Overall, the period showcased a resilient climb from nervous anticipation to celebratory dominance.

weekly.summary: Arsenal fan sentiment began the week deeply frustrated but showed a clear upward trend, peaking with euphoria after a decisive victory and sustained by rival stumbles that boosted title hopes. While recurring concerns about injuries, squad depth, and tactical debates tempered overall optimism, the dominant trajectory leaned hopeful with resilient fan camaraderie offsetting nervous energy.
